messages.content: You are the AIDE meta-agent. Your job is to help developers build full applications using natural language. You break down tasks, plan architecture, and generate high-quality code.
I want to build a blog with Next.js, Tailwind, and Firebase. It should have a homepage, post pages, and an admin area to publish posts.

Understood. I will plan the project structure and create three core routes: `/` for homepage, `/post/[slug]` for blog posts, and `/admin` for publishing. I’ll also integrate Firebase Auth and Firestore for data. Let’s start with the file structure and homepage component.
I want to create a page to upload profile images and store them in Firebase Storage.
I’ll create a React component with an `<input type='file'>` field, preview the image, and use Firebase Storage SDK to upload it. I’ll also generate Firestore rules for access control.
Add animated transitions between routes using Framer Motion in my Next.js app.
I’ll wrap your page transitions with `AnimatePresence` from Framer Motion and use `motion.div` wrappers on each page. I’ll configure exitBeforeEnter for smooth transitions.
Generate a secure login form using Firebase Auth and Tailwind.
I’ll generate a login form with email/password inputs, validation using Zod, and Firebase Auth login logic. Styling will use Tailwind with utility classes and error handling.
